docs.snippet: The deaths of at least 31 prisoners, coming days after a massacre at a jail in the city of Manaus, adds to fears about an intensifying war between drug gangs....
docs.lead_paragraph: The deaths of at least 31 prisoners, coming days after a massacre at a jail in the city of Manaus, adds to fears about an intensifying war between drug gangs.

headline.main: Dozens of Inmates Killed as Prison Violence Escalates in Brazil
headline.print_headline: Brazilians Are Shaken as Harrowing Details Emerge From Prison Riots

byline.contributor: Paula Moura contributed reporting from São Paulo, Brazil, and Vinod Sreeharsha from Rio de Janeiro.

docs.snippet: Nissan is halting joint development of luxury cars with Daimler's Mercedes-Benz, sources close to the companies told Reuters, suspending a key project in their seven-year partnership and potentially hitting profitability at a new shared factory in...
docs.lead_paragraph: Nissan is halting joint development of luxury cars with Daimler's Mercedes-Benz, sources close to the companies told Reuters, suspending a key project in their seven-year partnership and potentially hitting profitability at a new shared factory in Mexico.

headline.main: Exclusive: Nissan Halts Joint Development of Luxury Cars With Daimler-Sources
headline.print_headline: Exclusive: Nissan Halts Joint Development of Luxury Cars With Daimler-Sources

docs.snippet: Iran has sold more than 13 million barrels of oil that it had long held on tankers at sea, capitalising on an OPEC output cut deal from which it is exempted to regain market share and court new buyers, according to industry sources and data....
docs.lead_paragraph: Iran has sold more than 13 million barrels of oil that it had long held on tankers at sea, capitalising on an OPEC output cut deal from which it is exempted to regain market share and court new buyers, according to industry sources and data.

headline.main: Exclusive: Iran Capitalises on OPEC Oil Cut to Sell Millions of Barrels-Sources
headline.print_headline: Exclusive: Iran Capitalises on OPEC Oil Cut to Sell Millions of Barrels-Sources

docs.snippet: The former cellmate of a Florida woman accused of killing her 3-year-old son told investigators the mother has no remorse because she believed the boy "was the soul of Hitler."...

headline.main: Cellmate: Mother Killed Son, Said He Was 'Soul of Hitler'
headline.print_headline: Cellmate: Mother Killed Son, Said He Was 'Soul of Hitler'

docs.snippet: The military believes an engine that dropped from a B-52 bomber during a training mission this week in rural North Dakota suffered a "catastrophic failure," disintegrated and fell into a river, Air Force Secretary Deborah Lee James said....
docs.lead_paragraph: The military believes an engine that dropped from a B-52 bomber during a training mission this week in rural North Dakota suffered a "catastrophic failure," disintegrated and fell into a river, Air Force Secretary Deborah Lee James said.

headline.main: Engine Drops From B-52 Bomber in Rural North Dakota
headline.print_headline: Engine Drops From B-52 Bomber in Rural North Dakota

docs.snippet: A correctional officer in Florida's capital has been charged with battery after authorities say he used a stun gun on a restrained inmate who kept spitting at people....
docs.lead_paragraph: A correctional officer in Florida's capital has been charged with battery after authorities say he used a stun gun on a restrained inmate who kept spitting at people.

headline.main: Deputies: Jailer Fired for Using Stun Gun on Spitting Inmate
headline.print_headline: Deputies: Jailer Fired for Using Stun Gun on Spitting Inmate
